verses.kjv: Then Jonah prayed unto the LORD his God out of the fish’s belly,
verses.web: Then Jonah prayed to LORD, his God, out of the fish’s belly.
verses.ct: From inside the belly of the fish, Jonah prayed to the LORD his God.

verses.kjv: And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the LORD, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.
verses.web: He said, “I called because of my affliction to LORD. He answered me. Out of the belly of Sheol I cried. You heard my voice.
verses.ct: He said, "In my distress I cried out to the LORD, and he answered me. From the depths of the grave I called for help, and you heard my voice.

verses.kjv: For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
verses.web: For you threw me into the depths, in the heart of the seas. The flood was all around me. All your waves and your billows passed over me.
verses.ct: You hurled me into the deep, into the heart of the sea. Currents swirled around me, and all your waves and breakers crashed over me.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
verses.web: I said, ‘I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.’
verses.ct: I thought, 'I've been thrown out of your sight.' But even then, I held on to hope that I would see your holy temple again.

verses.kjv: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.
verses.web: The waters surrounded me, even to the soul. The deep was around me. The weeds were wrapped around my head.
verses.ct: The water closed in around me, threatening my very soul. The deep engulfed me, and seaweed wrapped around my head.

verses.kjv: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O LORD my God.
verses.web: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains. The earth barred me in forever: yet have you brought up my life from the pit, LORD my God.
verses.ct: I sank to the roots of the mountains. The earth locked its gates behind me forever. But you, LORD my God, pulled my life up from the pit.

verses.kjv: When my soul fainted within me I remembered the LORD: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.
verses.web: “When my soul fainted within me, I remembered LORD. My prayer came in to you, into your holy temple.
verses.ct: As my soul was slipping away, I remembered the LORD. My prayer reached you, all the way into your holy temple.

verses.kjv: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
verses.web: Those who regard lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
verses.ct: Those who cling to worthless idols throw away the mercy that could be theirs.

verses.kjv: But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the LORD.
verses.web: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to LORD.”
verses.ct: But I will offer you a sacrifice with shouts of thanksgiving. I will fulfill every vow I've made. Salvation belongs to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
verses.web: Then LORD spoke to the fish, and it vomited out Jonah on the dry land.
verses.ct: Then the LORD commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
